title: 10 Wool Rugs That’ll Instantly Make Your Space More Cozy
author: Haley Lyndes
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingHaley LyndesCommerce SEO WriterHaley LyndesCommerce SEO WriterI'm the SEO writer for both Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. I'm passionate about interior design, decor hacks, finding comfortable bedding (since she sleeps hot), and starting my day with a warm cup of coffee. My work has been featured in BuzzFeed, PopSugar, Travel + Leisure, and other publications. published yesterdayWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Redecorating my apartment has been a slow (very slow) process, but it’s taught me a lot about budgeting and knowing when to splurge. I’ve realized that the sweet spot is finding brands that are affordable but not cheap. These brands tend to offer better quality without completely wrecking your budget. Sure, there are exceptions, but this rule is one that’s yet to let me down. One brand I keep going back to is Rugs USA, especially when it’s having a sale. If there’s one thing you should get from them (speaking as someone who owns two), it’s a wool rug. Wool is soft, durable, and naturally stain-resistant, making it perfect for a busy home. Plus, Rugs USA has amazing sales — like their Wrap-Up Sale, where you can grab one of these gorgeous, high-quality rugs for 20% off with code WRAP20. Trust me, it’s worth it. Your floors — and your wallet — will thank you!2 / 10Rugs USA$101.95In my living room, I have the Arrel Speckled Wool-Blend Rug, and it’s easily one of my favorites. Designed in collaboration with Arvin Olano — one of my go-to YouTube designers — it’s made from 80% wool and 20% viscose. The sleek, low-pile design not only feels comfortable underfoot but also adds a polished touch to my space. And let me tell you, it’s a total conversation starter. I’ve lost count of how many compliments I get!3 / 10Rugs USA$339.95Rugs USA frequently collaborates with exciting personalities, and in November, it launched a new rug collection with NBA couple Kate and Kevin Love. The collection features neutral designs, including this one, which showcases Southwestern-inspired touches and is made from 100% wool.4 / 10Rugs USA$303.95This handmade rug features a subtle rectangular pattern, but its real standout detail is the striped texture. Available in a stunning rust color (along with four other hues), the Starke Rug effortlessly anchors any space and brings a cozy touch to otherwise bare rooms. The fact that it’s made from 100% wool and priced under $300 is just the cherry on top!5 / 10Rugs USA$454.95Most of Rugs USA’s rugs come in neutral colors that are super easy to style, but if you want something that really makes a statement, check out the Petra Rug in this bold golden tone. Even with its vibrant color and patterned border, the low-pile design keeps it from being too much — it just adds a warm, sunny vibe to any room.6 / 10Rugs USA$350.95If you've got white or gray floors, the Marlowe Rug’s warm light brown tone is perfect for adding some cozy vibes to your space. We love the delicate border — its smaller rectangle pattern contrasts nicely with the larger design in the center. This rug’s great for breaking up a room, whether it’s your dining room, bedroom, or anywhere else you choose. It’s unique, but not in an overwhelming way.7 / 10Rugs USA$160.95If you're after a simple yet luxurious rug that’ll subtly complement your furniture, the Southwest Rug is a great choice. It comes in a few landscape-inspired colors, but the green has such a calming, natural feel. This rug also has a striped pattern, but the texture is on the smaller side, so it’s low-key yet still adds a touch of sophistication to any room.8 / 10Rugs USA$140.95If you liked the Elliot Rug (which I have in my bedroom), you’ll love the Remy Rug. It’s perfect for rooms that aren’t too busy and features a rectangular pattern that almost looks like a wall of bricks, especially if you go for the brown color. There’s really no better way to make your room feel cozier than by adding this hand-tufted wool rug to it.9 / 10Rugs USA$232.95Going for a more laid-back look? Check out the Brooklyn Tasseled Rug. It has a simple gray wool base, but the white and black lines at the ends really make it pop. We’re also loving the small tassels and rustic texture. Plus, it’s super durable, so it’d be a great addition to your home’s go-to hangout spots — like the kitchen or dining room.10 / 10Rugs USA$225.95The SoHo Rug features an artsy, raised design on a gorgeous brown flatweave. It’s perfect if you want to add some texture to your space or break up a room that feels a little bland. The contrasting colors and tasseled edges give it a fun design while still feeling sophisticated.Apartment Therapy's Home RunsGet full reviews of editor-favorite finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Decorating
  • Decor & Accessories
  • Shopping

Haley LyndesCommerce SEO Writer

Haley LyndesCommerce SEO Writer

I'm the SEO writer for both Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. I'm passionate about interior design, decor hacks, finding comfortable bedding (since she sleeps hot), and starting my day with a warm cup of coffee. My work has been featured in BuzzFeed, PopSugar, Travel + Leisure, and other publications.

published yesterday

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Redecorating my apartment has been a slow (very slow) process, but it’s taught me a lot about budgeting and knowing when to splurge. I’ve realized that the sweet spot is finding brands that are affordable but not cheap. These brands tend to offer better quality without completely wrecking your budget. Sure, there are exceptions, but this rule is one that’s yet to let me down.

One brand I keep going back to is Rugs USA, especially when it’s having a sale. If there’s one thing you should get from them (speaking as someone who owns two), it’s a wool rug. Wool is soft, durable, and naturally stain-resistant, making it perfect for a busy home. Plus, Rugs USA has amazing sales — like their Wrap-Up Sale, where you can grab one of these gorgeous, high-quality rugs for 20% off with code WRAP20. Trust me, it’s worth it. Your floors — and your wallet — will thank you!

2 / 10

Rugs USA

$101.95

In my living room, I have the Arrel Speckled Wool-Blend Rug, and it’s easily one of my favorites. Designed in collaboration with Arvin Olano — one of my go-to YouTube designers — it’s made from 80% wool and 20% viscose. The sleek, low-pile design not only feels comfortable underfoot but also adds a polished touch to my space. And let me tell you, it’s a total conversation starter. I’ve lost count of how many compliments I get!

3 / 10

Rugs USA

$339.95

Rugs USA frequently collaborates with exciting personalities, and in November, it launched a new rug collection with NBA couple Kate and Kevin Love. The collection features neutral designs, including this one, which showcases Southwestern-inspired touches and is made from 100% wool.

4 / 10

Rugs USA

$303.95

This handmade rug features a subtle rectangular pattern, but its real standout detail is the striped texture. Available in a stunning rust color (along with four other hues), the Starke Rug effortlessly anchors any space and brings a cozy touch to otherwise bare rooms. The fact that it’s made from 100% wool and priced under $300 is just the cherry on top!

5 / 10

Rugs USA

$454.95

Most of Rugs USA’s rugs come in neutral colors that are super easy to style, but if you want something that really makes a statement, check out the Petra Rug in this bold golden tone. Even with its vibrant color and patterned border, the low-pile design keeps it from being too much — it just adds a warm, sunny vibe to any room.

6 / 10

Rugs USA

$350.95

If you've got white or gray floors, the Marlowe Rug’s warm light brown tone is perfect for adding some cozy vibes to your space. We love the delicate border — its smaller rectangle pattern contrasts nicely with the larger design in the center. This rug’s great for breaking up a room, whether it’s your dining room, bedroom, or anywhere else you choose. It’s unique, but not in an overwhelming way.

7 / 10

Rugs USA

$160.95

If you're after a simple yet luxurious rug that’ll subtly complement your furniture, the Southwest Rug is a great choice. It comes in a few landscape-inspired colors, but the green has such a calming, natural feel. This rug also has a striped pattern, but the texture is on the smaller side, so it’s low-key yet still adds a touch of sophistication to any room.

8 / 10

Rugs USA

$140.95

If you liked the Elliot Rug (which I have in my bedroom), you’ll love the Remy Rug. It’s perfect for rooms that aren’t too busy and features a rectangular pattern that almost looks like a wall of bricks, especially if you go for the brown color. There’s really no better way to make your room feel cozier than by adding this hand-tufted wool rug to it.

9 / 10

Rugs USA

$232.95

Going for a more laid-back look? Check out the Brooklyn Tasseled Rug. It has a simple gray wool base, but the white and black lines at the ends really make it pop. We’re also loving the small tassels and rustic texture. Plus, it’s super durable, so it’d be a great addition to your home’s go-to hangout spots — like the kitchen or dining room.

10 / 10

Rugs USA

$225.95

The SoHo Rug features an artsy, raised design on a gorgeous brown flatweave. It’s perfect if you want to add some texture to your space or break up a room that feels a little bland. The contrasting colors and tasseled edges give it a fun design while still feeling sophisticated.
